If a word, phrase, text, etc. is referential, it is used to refer to a particular person or thing: The study investigates the use of referential expressions, such as pronouns, in a narrative discourse. The referential function of pointing may precede naming in children's language development.
making a reference to (= mentioning) another writer, text, film, etc.: Sitcoms have become ever more referential and self-conscious. Blogs tend to be informal, cheap to produce, free to consume, and heavily referential.
More examplesFewer examplesThe paper considers the lexical and referential cues that children use to resolve sentences containing ambiguity.We found that the referential pronoun "it" was used by all children.
